11121.content:
On the science spaceship you work on, the Guinevere, several members are working on experiments, but they also brought their families, who perform other duties, such as cooking, cleaning, maintenance, etc.

Several families also bring their children along. Which necessitates a place to keep the babies, toddlers, and young children.

Randall Kauffman, a study of children's development and nursing, runs the 'Spacecare' (A funny portmanteau of 'space' and 'daycare' that Jean came up with), seeing how living on a ship could affect child development.

Several nurses and volunteers helped him out in taking care of the children.

Randall walked into the Spacecare, and, as part of his routine inspection, started by looking into one of the rooms.
11121.title: You run a daycare on the ship, studying develop...

choices: The children enter and are well behaved and intelligent
The children enter and aren't well behaved or intelligent
The children enter and are developmentally behind than expected
111213.content:
The effects of space travel on human development were much in the dark. Despite the hundred years of interstellar travel and the spread of human presence amongst the stars; there was still more to learn on the long-term effects of development of the human mind and body while stationed in space. A routine checkup on the children of the Guinevere was absolutely standard; to ensure the rollout of rations and equipment for the day to keep the kids occupied, with Randall Kaufman, dutifully accepting the responsibility of overseeing the Mars room for an entire peta-cycle.

The doors to the Mars room open, revealing a medium sized lounging zone decorated with several chairs and a large table rested in the middle. An oval window reavealed the vast view of space and the nearby planet -- Ulin'Tahn. He enter's the room and is immediately greeted by one of the nurses.

"Greetings, Mr. Kaufman." Nurse Julie nods, she gently interlocks her hands and straightens her posture. "Here for a routine checkup of the children?"

"Business as usual," He chuckles, stepping forward with a checklist in hand, "I'm here to also deliver the new ration cards. The dispencer for the protein gel malfuctioned and a replacement will be sent out from the surface of Ulin'Tahn soon enough."

"Yes," Nurse Julie felt her cheeks redden, "The malfunction of the protein dispencer was most unfortunate. I don't know what went wrong. I couldn't possibly give an explanation. The children were saddened to hear they wouldn't receive their favourite nutrient for lunch."

"How are the kids?" Randal asked, he slowly walked over to a nearby terminal and began accessing the room's information.

"If you'd like, we can bring them from their resting pods." Nurse Jolie responded, "There hasn't been a proper inspection since the last cycle. I'm sure it'll jog their memory."

"Wonderful." Randal clapped his hands, smiling. "An inspection. It's been a while since I've seen them."

The nurse quickly leaves through one of the sliding doors; leaving Randal to wait for a few minutes before hearing the familiar voices of children and the nurse herself. He readies his checklist and begins to ready his pen.
111213.title: The 'Mars' room for children.

choices: Randall spends some time with Chirran and attempts to help her learn
Randall spends more time with Nurse Jolie and requests profiles for the children
Chirran interrupts Randall's thoughts by using her diaper
1112133.content:
He forced a smile; as well as Randall could muster, knowing the circumstances regarding the group of children in the Mars room and felt a twinge of sadness as they came into view. The children -- despite being placed in educational ship with the best learning equipment known to humans everywhere -- were developmentally behind in ways that would make most parents worried. The children slowly toddled in, waddling with obvious thick bulges underneath their jumpsuits as their focus on the holo-projector was above everything else.

"All seven," Nurse Jolie called, she entered last with the final child holding her hand. She stood before Randall and presented one of the girls, only to be met with a shy reaction as she hid behind Nurse Jolie's leg. "This is Chirran. She's one of the brightest, but happens to be a little shy -- as you can see."

The child beared tattoo-like markings across her face, light blue in tone, with silver hair and a bright set of orange eyes. A gentle crouching motion by Randall allowed him to get a better look at her,

"A Chil'uluan?"

"Indeed," Nurse Jolie replied, "The warrior humans. Hailing from Arcturus IV, their young are marked with tattoo's -- being a mark for their family symbol." She stepped aside, removing Chirran's sudden protection against Randall and stood; vacantly staring at the inspector with a half-open mouth, lightly humming in curiosity.

"Hello, Chirran." Randal introduced himself, smiling. "I'm Randall. Nice to meet you."

"She hasn't learned many words," Nurse Jolie added, her usual smile dropped. "Nine years of age. I'm afraid to say her development has been slow; but much quicker than the others. She's polite, can keep her attention for much longer than the others and happens to be on the edge of feeding herself."

Alas; to Randall, the group of children were the latest in a long line of test subjects to undergo resistance to cosmic radiation and the unexplained forces of space. Their development was impaired, slower and more rigourous. Instead of the civilised, intelligent and well-behaved children they were originally supposed to be -- the group resembled an overgrown group of toddlers.

The job had to be done. It was time for Randall to spend time with several of the children and review their development since the last recorded cycle.
1112133.title: The children are developmentally behind

1121.title: A scan of a mysterious planet

choices: The descent to the surface is a safe and uneventful one.
The descent is a bumpy one, leaving Ella injured.
The descent is rough. With the shuttle becoming damaged and torn upon landing.
11211.content:
Arriving at Aphios 21b.

Such a strange name for a planet. Especially given the archive of recently-discovered planets hadn't lead to a discovery as fascinating as this one in years. The planet, Aphios, a lush forest planet seemed to be piquing the interest of the brightest minds across the Human Continuum due to an unsual discovery. The discovery; being a energy field surrounding the celestial body -- emitted a type of energy no scientific instrument could properly attempt to understand.

Captain Castilla of The Montevado was taken aback by the simplicity of the mission. Land, observe and collect possibly any usable information for the scientists back on Morden to properly analyse. In addition; there also appeared to be life-signs on the surface. Intelligent? Civilised? Wild? Other humans? The confusing nature of the energy barrier prevented a complete scan of all life on the surface of the planet. As silly as it was -- there was single life-sign coming back and identifying as human amongst others which couldn't be properly pin pointed.

The discussion to enter the planet's atmosphere was long and arduous. The risks of lowering the Montevado into an atmosphere with an unknown energy field was simply too dangerous, or perhaps, completely harmless. A great deal of equipment and supplies would be needed; including that of a fabricator to remotely spawn in materials and other types of supplies for an extended ground mission.

"A single human?" Head Scientist Frobisher had analysed what little information there was on the crew room's monitor. "How unlikely. It's just a malfuction, right? This planet, according to our archives, hasn't been touched by humans or any other civilization."

"We need to be prepared." Captain Castilla replied, she slowly leaned forward against the desk and rubbed her chin. "All scenario's need to be taken into account. If there is life down there; including human, we need to move ahead and prepare for a possible friendly, hostile or neutral advancement. Diplomacy is currently our best strategy and I want to keep 'violence' as a last-chance."

"What about the ship, Captain?" The ship's Engineer, Ella, inquired, "The energy field is made of strange particles. If we run the ship through; who knows what's going to happen? We can't risk damaging the engines or any of our equipment. What if we're stranded? If our communications equipment is damaged then we'll be stranded."

"Good point," Castilla nodded, "We can probably take a small shuttle. Boost the shields to one-hundred and ten percent and that should grant us safe passage to a landing zone near the human signature."

"This is a bad idea." Ashton, the Head of Security shook his head. His lips curled, grey beard twitching, "We can't lose our Captain to a basic exploration mission. Rules and regulations are set in place for a reason -- there must be a Captain on the ship at all times when crew are present. How are the rest going to react when you're gallavanting on that planet below?"

"I volunteer to go, Captain." Frobisher raised his hand, his eyes sunk to the surface of the table. "In the name of knowledge itself, and the ensured survival of the human species."

"Me too." Ella added, also raising her hand. Her face began to burn a slight red as Frobisher soon glanced surprisingly in her direction. "For the name of... Knowledge and stuff."

Aston grumbled, "Oh for heaven's sake. You two can't just go, the rest of us need to stick together."

The debating and ebb towards bickering in the quarters left Captain Castilla to silently ponder on her own personal decision. She nodded, vision soon glancing to the table, and stood up; leaving the room silent. "I've come to a decision. Ashton's worries are genuine and I acknowledge his concerns about my safety -- but I'm agreeing with Ella and Frobisher. A small shuttle should be of minimal loss instead of the Montevado itself."

"Oh, Claire-Arden Castilla..." Ashton groaned.

---

The preparations and goodbyes were done. For Captain Castilla, Frobisher and Ella, the three crew members completed their final requirements and prepared to leave in the shuttle ship. The shields were boosted, thanks to Ella's technical expertise, and the scientific equipmenta and supplies were sorted by Frobisher's list's -- list's which he read four times in a row.

"Preperations complete." Frobisher announced, "We leave in two minutes. Strap in to harnesses; brace for impact as we collide with the energy field."

"Brace for impact?" Ella felt her cheeks puff, "That sounds so serious! My work done to the shields should be more than enough to keep us safe."

"As I was saying," Frobisher rolled his eyes, smiling, "Brace for impact. Stuff that's been said before, any other words, Captain Castilla?"

"You've done well," Castilla nodded, she took a nearby seat and tightened her belts.

"I should be stopping this shuttle, y'know." Ashton's voice came through the communication's link, "Goes against every rule and regulation we've set up to ensure health and safety, Captain."

"Need to break a few eggs to make an omelette, Ashton." Captain Castilla replied, inhaling as the ship began to ignite its engines. "We're leaving for three deca-cycles. We'll attempt to make communication once we land on terra firma. If we fail to initiate communication, send help."

"Better come back in one piece, Claire."

"We will. We've got enough supplies to last us for several ecta-cycles."

"What about us?" Frobisher adjusted his glasses, frowning.

"You're replacable. The Captain isn't."

"Ha-ha, Ashton." Frobisher rolled his eyes, further drifting his gaze away from Ella as she giggled.

The ship slowly left the docking bay. The engines ignited further and slowly descended towards the planet's atmosphere -- a show of strange colours and lights soon flickered through the shuttle's windows as the shields began to take the brunt of the strange energy field. The on-board navigational system locked onto the life-signs below and began tracking.
11211.title: Everyone who makes planet fall never leaves

choices: ...north, nearby a snowy mountain."
...south, nearby a sunny beach."
...east, next to a river valley."
...west, next to a windy forest."
112111.content:
Barring the energy field's attacks on the shields, the descent was smooth and calculated, and soon, the three landed on the surface of the planet Aphios.

"I'll try and pull up that map we made..." said Frobisher. But when he tapped the 'map' button on his Multidevice, it didn't work. He tapped it again. And again.

"Must be the energy field," Ella suggested pulling up the pictures taken from orbit of the area they landed in. "Alright, got the one with the life signatures. The human one appears to be close, but a bit of a walk away from here. It should be to the..."
112111.title: The descent to the surface is a safe and uneven...

choices: Ella dives into the water and saves the rabbit
Frobisher leans into the river and saves the rabbit
Captain Castilla uses a wooden rod and saves the rabbit
1121113.content:
A few minutes of preperation quickly led Frobisher and Ella to assemble a sizable portion of supplies. Food; water and scientific equipment were all standard -- in addition with several military-grade blasters with stun fuction and a single proteon assault rifle with plenty of energy cells. The shuttle was eventually locked down, with the cloaking device being activated which gave Captain Castilla to finally call point and move her exploration team forward into the strange planet.

As strange as it was; the beauty of the world surrounding her couldn't be ignored. The planet was a paradise. Surrounding open fields of greenery and distant mountains aplenty brought a sense of wonder and scale. A rich blue river split the landscape in two -- providing the purest clear water she, and the rest of her team, had ever witnessed.

"Such a perplexing landscape." Frobisher was left to comment. The journey towards the human life-sign eventually paused, leaving the group to aimlessly wander and inspect the nature surrounding them. A small break by the edge of the river allowed the team to reflect and inspect the landscape in greater detail. "I don't think I've witnessed a more perfect-looking world before."

Ella blinked, "You can say that again. Where else y'gonna get a view like this?"

"I don't..." Frobisher paused, shaking his head, "I don't mean to say it like that. Something feels off. The air is too clean; there's barely any clouds in the sky and the water is too clear to look natural at all."

"You're over-thinking things," Ella chuckled, she lowered her backpack and equipment to take a seat near the edge of the river. "We've been to loads of awful lookin' planets before. Face it, boyo. We got lucky."

"Captain...?" Frobisher groaned, he glanced at Castilla pleadingly.

"I have to admit;" Captain Castilla nodded, "It's a beautiful planet. If the scanners are working, we can assess the pollution and carbon monoxide levels. But, looks can be deceiving. We need to keep focused on locating that one human life-sign."

"Yes, ma'am!" Ella responded.

"And Frobisher...?" Captain Castilla added, "Frobisher?"

The chief scientist had moved -- suddenly appearing behind a large bush next to the river; with eyes wide open and a pair of binoculars raised to his face. Ella and Captain Castilla quickly followed,

"Report, Frobish--"

"Hush!" Frobisher hissed, "There's something near."

Peering from behind the bush, Castilla and Ella soon saw a small brown furry lifeform on the other side of the river. A small child-size creature emerged from behind several bushes and toddled over to the river; happily toddling toward the source of clean water. Upon closer inspection -- the small creature seemed to be the size of a small child, with an aura of innocence toward its surrounding enviroment.

"It appears to be an anthropomorphic rabbit of some description." Frobisher noted, he tuned his binoculars and enchanced the zoom to get a better look. "Limited intelligence? It's walking like a..."

"Toddler?" Ella added.

"It looks and acts young." Frobisher hummed, "Can't be certain. Lack of precision in walking, drool running down its chin and some strange underwear."

"Whatever it is;" Ella cooed, "It's wearing cute little underwear."

---

Seeming unaware of its own surroundings; the small rabbit idly toddled along the side of the river and occasionally took a handful of grass to munch. His legs eventually gave way and resorted to crawling as his focus on the river intensified -- giving in and reaching for a small handful of water. His body eventually took its toll and leaned forward far too much; leaving him to fall into the river with a mightly splash. His underwear soon expanded and absorbed several pockets of water and brought on a significant amount of weight, dragging his head underneath the rustled water.

He emitted a shriek of terror -- only to realise more water entered his lungs, leaving only the sounds muffled heavy footsteps to draw near along with a pair of unfamiliar hands grabbing him.
1121113.title: ...east, next to a river valley."

choices: Captain Castilla agrees to take the rabbit back to the shuttle
Captain Castilla decides to keep moving toward the signal
Ella decides to stay put until the rabbit awakens
11211131.content:
Ella had decided to take the plunge into the cold water. Out of sheer instinct; she threw off her jacket and rushed past Castilla and Frobisher with a sudden focus on the drowning toddler -- throwing herself head-first into the river with her arms quickly wrapping around the rabbit's short furry body. Both their heads quickly re-emerged from the depths of the river -- leaving the small antropomorphic rabbit to wail and cry in sheer confusion as his body was carried ashore.

"Elenore Baker!" Captain Castilla gasped, she ran aside the edge of the river and gestured to be handed the small toddler. Once in her arms -- despite the sudden wriggling and wailing -- gently rested him down on Ella's brown jacket and blanketed his small body. While unperturbed by the water; Ella soon rose from the river and rushed to the rabbit's aide, gently rocking and hushing the toddler in her arms.

"Hey, hey, hey." Ella delicately hushed, "You're safe now. Ain't no river gonna take you down anytime soon."

The small rabbit continued to cry, his wails soon hushed from a loud whimper to a series of light sniffles in Ella's soaking arms. She quickly tore off the toddler's heavy underwear and tossed it aside, using more of her jacket to keep the rabbit warm.

"Hng-- Sorry... Mumma..." The rabbit coughed, small pockets of water soon exited his mouth and onto Ella's chest. His green eyes soon opened, with a trail of drool escaping his lips and down onto his sodden chest, "You're not.. You're not Mumma..."

"Just a friend, sweetheart." Ella nodded, "What's your name, little guy?"

He stared into Ella's eyes; unable to concentrate enough to register the words spoken to him in time, only for his natural response to the sudden stress of the situation was to insert his fingers into his mouth. He resumed whimpering -- but readily accepted Ella's comforting cuddle.

"That was incredible, Ella." Frobisher finally caught up, hauling his equipment with a series of exhausted steps. "You saved a baby from drowning."

"Can't help myself," Ella playfully shrugged, "This sweetheart ain't letting up neither. He's clung to my chest harder than a shuttle harness."

A simple pat on the rabbit's head from Captain Castilla caused the toddler to squirm in Ella's arms. His wet fur combined with the surprisingly lop-sided ears felt awfully strange, "You've saved a life. I wasn't expecting us to come into contact with native life so early in the mission; thinking recon was the best way to handle things. We should find his parents and return him before something else happens."

"If he leads us back to his parent's; then perhaps we can find the human signature? It's close by, according to my scanner." Frobisher added.

"Hate to be the bearer of bad news;" Ella interrupted, chuckling, "But he's fallen asleep. Poor little fella, the stress of the situation must'a took the rays outta him." The small rabbit was delicately wrapped; head resting on Ella's damp shoulder with her hands supporting him backside and legs.

"Well," Frobisher sighed, "What now, Captain? Follow the signature or take the rabbit back to the shuttle for examination?"

"We ain't disecting him, alright?" Ella protested.

"Don't be ridiculous," Frobisher rolled his eyes, "We aren't going to harm a baby. That's against the rules of galactic engagment."

"The signature is close; but I do agree a proper examination and a medical check suing our equipment for the little rabbit might be necessary." Captain Castilla added.
11211131.title: Ella dives into the water and saves the rabbit

choices: The rabbit awakens and Ella greets him
Frobisher learns something unusual about the rabbit
Captain Castilla discovers the communication equipment is damaged
112111311.content:
The journey back to the shuttle was brief. A simple command from Captain Castilla removed the ship's cloaking device allowing herself and the rest of her crew to enter; giving Ella space to take the toddler-sized rabbit to the nearby living quarters -- still wrapped in her soaked brown jacket. The rabbit was delicately rested against a nearby pillow while Ella acquired a towel and began softly rubbing his brown fur; while the droplets of water were being absorbed, the rabbit began mumbling in his sleep. Still curled, instictively suckled on his fingers while resting.

Frobisher took a nearby seat, frowning, at the rabbit's infantile display of behaviour. He clicked the roof of his mouth -- only to roll his eyes before reaching for his audio recorder nearby, "We've landed on terra firma. Our shuttle easily passed through the mysterious energy field with little issue with our shields taking the full brunt of the damage. A full sitrep of the shuttle's capacity to re-enter orbit is required. We've spent a meagre two hours on Aphios and already discovered a native, obviously non-human, which appears to resemble an anthromorphic rabbit. I've never seen a combination of the two before. Intelligence levels? Unsure."

The rabbit was quickly further wrapped in appropriate blankets and medical equipment. His small body was gently laid upon a medical capsule which began tracking his pulse, continually beeping at a healthy rate. Ella leaned over the capsule's top, sliding the back of her hand across the rabbit's forehead with a worrying expression.

"Poor tyke," Ella hummed, "Hope bunny boy doesn't freak out when he wakes up."

"He's going to be fine, Ella." Captain Castilla responded, she glanced at the medical information appearing on a nearby monitor, "His vitals are still working. No serious injuries or bruising."

"I know, I know." Ella groaned, she took a step back and scratched her head. "Just couldn't let him drown. His parents are probably worried sick. They're probably looking for him, right now."

"That's if he has parents." Frobisher stood from his seat, discarding his audio recorder onto a nearby desk, and slowly walked over to the medical capsule. "Or perhaps he's an underdeveloped being with a mind not as smart as ours. He could be the standard for the rest of his kind -- whatever his 'kind' is."

"A whole race of cute little bunny people?" Ella asked, "That sounds like a win right there. I'd cuddle them." She dipped her hand through the medical capsule and began to stroke the rabbit's ears, with the little rabbit emitting several light coo's and mumbles in his sleep.

"We'll attempt first contact protocal when he's awake." Captain Castilla explained, "If he's really just a baby then we'll need to take this slowly. Frobisher, learn what you can about the rabbit's physiology and brain activity. I'm going to try and communicate Aston."

"Yes Ma'am." Ella responded.

"Yes, boss." Frobisher responded with a salute.
112111311.title: Captain Castilla agrees to take the rabbit back

choices: Bup rushed out of the glass dome and looked for the potty
Bup couldn't hold it and wet himself
Ella lets him out and looks for a makeshift diaper
1121113111.content:
Night was approaching.

A series of strange discoveries were made upon researching the infantile rabbit. With the medical bay working; Frobisher had discovered that traces of the energy field were flowing throughout the rabbit's body. Even stranger, the physical age of the rabbit's body differed from the brain -- resulting in a small anthropomorphic rabbit that's, supposedly, lived for nearly two-hundred years. The brain was astonishing. The development of the brain resembled that of a four-year old human's, with an apparent lack of growth or development for as long as the creature has been alive.

Hours passed. Frobisher and Captain Castilla agreed to rest in the quarters, leaving Ella to watch over the shuttle and their new guest. The rabbit stirred in his sleep, tossing and turning; as his face twitched to the sound of loud humming. He opened his eyes and looked forward; and was immediately greeted to the sight of an unfamiliar face gazing through the glass shield. Panic and worry set in.

"Whuh-- Whuh-- Where am I?" He backed up against opposite side of the glass, idly kicking away the layers of blankets, and cowered in the corner.

"Hey, hey!" Ella reached for the release latch, allowing for the glass dome to partially open, "Don't you remember me? The lady from the river who saved your little tush?"

The rabbit blinked, he took a surrounding blanket and pulled it closer, "Y-You're not Mumma!"

"I'm a friend, kiddo." Ella cooed, she leaned inside the medical dome, slowly climbing inside and extended her hand over to the rabbit. "You fell asleep, bun' bun. I thought you'd like a blanket and a pillow t'rest on."

The rabbit's frantic breathing eventually softened. His small paws restlessly shook; clamping parts of his blanket between his legs. Ella's extended hand soon brushed against the rabbit's head -- after a small flinch, and finally stroked his lop-sided ears.

"Hey now, kiddo." Ella whispered, "I get it. You're scared. Y'probably want to go back home and see your Mommy?"

"Uh-huh." The rabbit nodded, "Mumma said I shun' wanna go by the water but I dun' listen."

"Ain't you a little rebel?" Ella grinned, "What yer' name fella?"

"Bup."

"Bup?"

Bup smiled, "I chose it myself! Mumma said I did a good when I did that!"

"Names Ella," Ella replied, chuckling. "Well now, ain't that a name for a cutie pie like yourself."

The tension between the two was immediately dismantled. Further into the conversation; Bup eventually lowered his defenses and slowly crawled over to Ella's chest -- glad accepting the warmth coming from her jumpsuit. "Miss Ella?"

"What is it, bun' bun?" Ella assisted Bup onto her lap, gladly wrapping a blanket across his cold furry body.

"I g-gotta go. I gotta g-go or else I 'uh-oh'." Bup whispered,

"Uh-oh?" Ella asked.
1121113111.title: The rabbit awakens and Ella greets him

choices: Bush
Tree
Rock
The outside of the dome
11211131111.content:
Bup got up and waddled away, muttering to himself.

"I gotta go... I gotta go... I gotta go..."

11232222121211222.content:
Zoe and Claudia were known as the love birds of the ATHENA program. Many times had a crewmate opened a closet to see the two kissing within, and if a closet was locked from within it was usually because they were doing more than kissing. Zoe was a mathematics genius while Claudia was more gung-ho, but they sincerely loved each other. They were constantly surprising each other with presents, and on every new world they would pick some flowers for each other. This practice had unintentionally doomed them to a second infancy.

-----

Zoe sighed, blowing a strand of her raven hair out of the way as she considered how she had ended up here. She was a very curvy and busty woman with pale skin and deep dark eyes, and a genius when it came to numbers. She had managed to calculate a way to escape a gravity well without using more fuel than normal. And yet here she was, changing the diaper of an adult woman. This woman was apparently the mayor of this little colony, but you wouldn't know it given how she gurgled and cooed. Indeed, she was a baby in all but body, as she still had her impressive bust (which put much of the ATHENA program to shame) and her round butt. She finished up the diaper change and put the mayor on the ground.

As the mayor crawled away she heard another baby wailing. She ignored it believing it another colonist, when in fact it was Corporal Alex Jones, the first member of the ATHENA member on the planet to succumb to the flowers influence. Zoe rubbed her temples and decided to do a calming strategy she had learned, counting the digits of Pi until she was calm. She started, "Three-point-one-four-one-five-nine-two." And then she stumbled, and she was puzzled. She could usually count the first hundred digits of Pi. She tried again, "Three-point-one-four-one-five-nine-two" and stumbled. She was getting scared now and tried a third time, "Three-point-one-four-one-five-nine-two".

She tried time tables next, "One times one is one. Two times two is." She was worried as she could remember, so she tried addition while lisping a bit, "One plus one is two, two plus two is." Once again she didn't know and she tried counting, "One, two, twee." Her eyes welled up with tears and she started to whimper, "What comes after twee?" She then burst in tears, wailing like an infant as she realized her mathematical genius, which was tied up with her self esteem and very identity, was gone.

Zoe needed someone to comfort her, and her regressing mind instantly turned to her mother. But her mother was back on Venus. She wouldn't just magically appear because Zoe wailed for her. Then she remembered Claudia, and while her regressing mind didn't fully understand the complexity's of there relationship she did know that she loved Claudia and Claudia loved her. Claudia would comfort her and take care of her and help her figure out why her smarts were going bye-bye. Zoe started toddling to the village and yelled out, "Cwadia."

-------

Claudia was currently searching the village for any clues as to why the colonists had become overgrown rugrats. She had platinum hair and creamy peach skin, she was attractive but also buff with a massive bust (not as massive as Zoe but still pretty big). She and Zoe were pretty much opposites, but they loved each other dearly. Claudia's hazel eyes searched for anything out of the ordinary. Something obviously hostile or strange, some hostile alien tech or a sigil of some sort. After all, some being did practice magic.

She remembered Zoe's frequent lectures that magic was in fact either highly advanced technology or higher-dimension math. Claudia didn't remember much of those lectures, she was always to focused on how Zoe moved her body when she was lecturing. She remembered Zoe's blush when she had made a remark about how this was good practice for when they got married and had a child of there own. She laughed at bit at that memory, but it came out more as a giggle. They had both agreed when they realized there mutual true love for one another that marriage would come when it felt right, and if they wanted kids they would adopt. But she loved when Zoe was embarrassed, she went so red that it reminded her of her childhood as a farmer on Mars.

She took a look at her laser pistol and realized something. She didn't understand how it worked, which confused her. She had set a record for the fastest disassembly and reassembly of a service laser pistol in the entire army. But now it was just a hunk of metal to her, one that was dangerous. She put the firearm down and decided to practice her kata's. This resulted in her falling down go boom, and she wailed. So many cool things she used to know she didn't anymore, like how to walk.

She stuck her thumb in her mouth, wanting someone to comfort her, She pictured her mommy, but she was back on her family farm on Mars. Mommy was too far away to help. She let out an infantile gasp as she realized who could help, Zoe. Zoe was smart, she could figure out why this was happening and how to fix it. Claudia got on her hands and knees and started to crawl while yelling, "Zoe."

------

Zoe and Claudia met near the village, both hugging each other and sobbing a bit. Zoe spoke first, "Me's forget math and smarty stuff" and sobbed some more. Claudia sobbed and said, "Me's forget cool stuff and hows to walkies" and let out some wails. After a while the two calmed down from there hug and Claudia asked, "Whys dis happening?" Zoe sniffled and said, "Me no know, but wes finds out." The two lovebirds nodded and began to crawl to where Zoe believed the investigation should start.

------

Having not yet entered the galactic community means not much is known about the history of the planet's people, but deep space observation shows that the society seemingly had something akin to the Cold War on earth, where the Autocratic side won, and now society is split into strong rigid groups with the military and political leaders on top, and those considered rebellious on the bottom.

But there is still hope. Many smaller governments still exist as holdouts of the past, and resistance groups are present in many major countries. What group do you decide to meet up with?

121211113211111212.content:
One of the only non-tropical islands on the planet is on it's south pole, and is also home to the only democratic government that is somewhat of a major player on the global scale. The island known as Rask is home to the Free State of Rask, and will be your new base. But first, you have to make contact.

The Marnic people are still using traditional radio, and science teams have already been able to hijack the radio, and make a comprehensive translation for all things that aren't proper nouns. Thanks to your galactic translator, everything you say will come out as Marnese to them, and everything they say will be understandable by you. A traditional radio has been set up in the bridge, Lola, Gillian, and Daniel stand around you, waiting to see what happens. You set yourself to the private broadcast of the largest observatory on the planet, one that has been set to listen for deep space contact.

"Uh, hello? Is there anyone on the other side?" You ask, unassuredly.

The response that comes back is one of a man's, and he sounds annoyed. "How'd you get on here? This is a private channel, I must ask you to get off this line, we are monitoring space sound waves."

"I'm in space," You say, "Consider this a first contact." You cringe at how amazingly lame that sounded. On the other side, their is a great deal of commotion. Several conversations are just barely caught by the receiver, and several times the validity of your call is put in question. "Uh, I'm sending coordinates to one of your computers, if you angle your telescope at it, you should be able to see a star turning on and off, that's our ship's lights." Once again, a great deal of commotion, then silence, then a chorus of excited screaming. "You see? Look, we are a people who want to help your planet, now may we have contact with your president?"

This time an answer is returned immediately, a different, female voice comes on. "We need one of our days to prepare, but yes alien, we will get you a meeting."

Soon the meeting comes, but little do you know, in the day you let them have, they are planning...

1212111132111112121.content:
You step on to the platform of the landing craft in your tight evening dress, a pistol secretly strapped to your inner thigh. Lola and Gillian are coming with as well, Lola as fire support and Gillian as the expert on Marnic culture. The cover of night protects your ship as it lands on the pavilion of the presidential complex. No one stands waiting on the pavilian, but as you enter the doors inside, a large banquet has been formed, and Marnics of all sorts look at you and gasp. Aliens might be a normal sight for you, but these aliens can hardly believe their eyes.

The first one to break the silence is the president, an older Marnic woman with long navy blue hair. "Welcome aliens, to our banquet! Who was it that spoke first over our radio?" You silently step forward. "Ah, welcome esteemed guest, the most honorable spot on this table has been reserved for you."

The night commences, you dine on Marnic food, speak with President Nalia, and spend most of the night residing at her left hand side, a mirror of tradition on earth. Lola and Gillian are seated to the left of you, and all night the three of you are baraged with questions, you never even find time to excuse yourself for the restroom, and the need to pee grows within you. It is far into the night when you finally have a moment spare of questions from inquisatorios senators and industry leaders. You turn to President Nalia, "Madame president, this is all well and good, but may I ask when we can start to plan how humanity can help bring democracy to this world?"

The president laughes at your request, "Nonsense, it is custom for the first night of any visit to be a banquet, we can start discussing politics tomorrow, until then, you and your companions are free to sleep in my mansion, if you do sleep that is."

Now that she mentions it, you are rather tired, you take her up on her offer and soon find yourself in one of the guest bedrooms of the house. You drop your dress off your shoulders and go to sleep immediately in your underwear.

While you sleep, do you wet yourself?

You giggle at the sight finding the image both amusing and cute and you see Gillian at your side holding a baby bottle of what you presume is milk and before you know it you're in Gillians embrace cuddled up against her your back lying against hers while she gently removes the Pacifier and inserts the nipple. 1212111132111112121312123222122112211213.content:
Five minutes pass and the aliens in the corner, your at the consoles, and the lack of anything to gag her with is becoming an extreme annoyance. "Well, can you tell me what you are, are you an alien? Are you taking over our planet?" These have been all the questions you've been getting for minutes, once the fear died down, she seemed to gain an interest in you.

Your patience breaks, and you finally respond to the incescent alien. "Yes, I am an alien, and no, I'm not taking over, I'm trying to save you from autocracy."

The alien is shocked that you respond, and pauses before her next question, "Like, democracy?"

"Yes democracy, now can you please be quiet or else I'll have to knock you out."

"Okay okay fine, one more question though, can you take me to Rask?"

You stop, is this Peloxi a defector? "You want asylum?"

The alien starts to jump in her spot, "Yes please, I'll do anything, I'll even help you with your mission. Uh, what is that mission anyway?"

You almost scold the alien for asking another question, but knowing that she's seeking help, and willing to help you, you decide to continue the conversation. You look up from the console and ask. "You can help, and I'll bring you back, but first, who are you?"

"Amelxi, my names Amelxi, and I'm the head engineer of this substation."

"Okay, what's up with the diaper?"

"I, uh, like them, I don't often wear them to work, though I'm kinda glad now. What about you, your waist isn't doing well to hide any secrets."

"I started needing them at night, but I'm kinda where you're at now."

Amelxi stops for a moment to let the conversation sink in. When not infront of her crew, she's a lot more sociable. "Okay, can I ask what's the mission you're on?"

Against your better judgement, you decide to trust her. "Alright, I'm gonna use the failures in the fuel line to cause an explosion, taking out the station and the freighters, weakoning the Peloxi governments."

Amelxi looks at you in fear, "You can't do that, that'll kill everyone, they'll just end up being afraid of democracy!"

:"Well do you have any better ideas? Cause all of my plans are kind of built around destroying the station."

Amelxi stops for a second, debates something in her mind, and then starts to speak, "Well, yes, sort of. There's this one thing, if you did it, the station would be completely useless, and no one would have to die, but it's kind of impossible, except for maybe an alien with future tech and a stealth suit."

"What is it?" You ask, apprehensive.

"I'll tell you, but you have to take me to your ship first."

12121111321111122.content:
Marnic society from all accounts is particularly strange. From reports, it's particularly focused on releasing oneself and escaping from the rules and expectations of society with a specific emphasis on regression and going back to your childhood pacing a strong emphasis on enjoying ones youth, it also has a patriarchal streak with women while able to hold jobs and high government positions are viewed as needing to be protected with Marnic views on escape and release particularly focused on women. This mostly manifests itself in the form of ageplay and roleplay and even in public life with Women often being encouraged to wear diapers as a method to remind them of their childhood and youth.

The rise of the modern Autocratic ideals across most of Prienne seemingly resulted from a worldwide conflict some 20 years before the present with a clash of two global alliances ending with the subjugation of most of the Priennes democratic states. Marnic society within the autocracies is highly restrictive with a Stratocracy being the norm in many states and a Caste system with government officials and military officers on the top and rebellious individuals and non-useful subjects on the Bottom.

Hope isn't lost though, many minor nations still remain outside the influence of the Autocratic states and the new autocratic puppet states established in former democratic nations are plagued with resistance groups and stay behind units.

Located on the island of Resyka you plan to use this Island a jumping off point for the destabilization and overthrow of the Autocratic governments.

The Marnic people are still using radio-based communications having not yet mastered the modern tight beam laser systems used by the modern powers in the galaxy. Premilinary teams have successfully translated the language and integrated the language into your universal translators which works both ways. A radio had been pre-installed on the Swan before you departed for your mission and now your crew May, Nora, and, Jackson are waiting for your contact with the Resyka government in order to begin your mission.

You awake in bed with a pounding headache. Your Bed, a quick and painful glance around confirmed to you that it was your private quarters on the Valiant currently docked in port as technicians and engineers scrambled over the vessel to fix minor breakdowns and to touch up her systems. A quick movement of your legs rewards a satisfying squish confirming the sodden state of your undergarment. Moving your hands around to find a grip you feel a person beside you. wait what? Sitting up and turning around you see none other than Jane Shepard resting beside you apparently fast asleep.

Thinking back to the night's antics you begin to piece back together what had happened. You and Shepard, as well as a few of her N7 buddies, had gone out looking for a place to drink. You hit a few bars, caught up with each other, did a bit of drunken dancing of which Shepard was not a participant, and most of all got yourselves thoroughly drunk. 1433111.content:
Heather Locke, the red haired human captain of Catherine's Armada, looked over her prize. It was a golden staff of alien design, with strange sigils adorning it. Her own knowledge of xenoarcheology let her know that almost all species looked identical to humans (at least on the outside) and she also knew that magic was merely high frame equations. But the Staff of Karban the Strong Willed would allow her to finally be rid of the pesky Themis crew, an all female law enforcement taskforce with the purpose of bringing her and her crew to justice, and to allow her crew to finally have unchallenged reign.

This ancient staff belonged to a queen of a long dead species, and was brought to her attention by a trusted informant. He was a man Heather could trust, and he had revealed to her the story of Karban. According to the informant, anyone who wielded the staff could turn anyone into completely loyal minions, and like all his tips it was right on the money. What Heather didn't know was that this informant was a child of a family murdered during one of her own raids. The child had grown up, and now had finally taken his revenge upon the ones who had killed his parents. It had taken many years, gaining Heather's trust, but it had paid off. For the real story of Karban the Strong Willed is a strange one, and the curse is very real.

Karban was a queen with a "romantic abnormality" to put it politely. She loved seeing adult baby women, and had the staff formed to reduce any woman into a babbling overgrown toddler or infant. Karban was a powerful mage and ensured that her harem was always full of women who wore diapers and had baby minds and instincts. However, her reign came to an end when she carelessly left her staff lying around and one of her harem started playing with it, reducing "mommy" Karban into adult infancy. In her last moments before she became an overgrown rugrat she cursed the staff so that no woman near the staff would escape the fate she had loved seeing others fall to and that now befell her.

Heather knew nothing of that however, and on the Freedom of Nobility, the flagship of this pirate fleet, the entirety of Catherine's Armada gathered to celebrate. As Heather got up, the staff started to take effect. She started to waddle a bit and said, "Huh, me panties fweel weird." Then she saw herself in a mirror and gasped. Her crimison red hair was in pigtails, and the only thing she wore was a diaper with a skull and crossbones on it. She gasped, and her perfect teeth were soon obscured by her thumb, which she started to suck furiously (Karban didn't like seeing women without teeth or hair, so she didn't have her staff do that, even when she cursed it). She then lisped, "Me in diapy?" and fell to the floor, no longer able to walk.

Soon every pirate of Catherine's Armada was effected just like there captain. Bottles and cups of alcohol became babas and sippy cups of milk or fruit juice. Bras vanished and the most mature of clothing were pull ups and toddler dresses. No one on board could move better than toddling. and baby furniture replaced that of adults. Where once the Freedom of Nobility was awash with the sound of female pirates celebrating, now it was awash in the sound of women mimicking babies. Some crawled around, completely regressed, while others started to wail and throw tantrums, all too aware of what they had lost.
1433111.title: Yes, bad luck and lots of diapers await

1442211.content:
Captain Taliah Black was head of one of the UFN's "black" prison ships maximum security prison ships vessels meant to hold serial killers, mass murders, war criminals, and other unmentionables with no chance of escape or parole. Often rife with violence and abuse from both guards and prisoners such ships are headed by hardboiled men and women whose strict attitudes and harsh prison regimes help maintain a semblance of order amongst the refuse of the galaxy. Taliah was one such Jailor, A-13 ran like clockwork Prisoners where kept in line with threats and brutality, and a rigorously trained and exercised guard force helped keep order on the ship one of the best disciplined "black" ships in the UFN. Yet, for all the rumours and exaggerations about A-13s Captain for those who've met her, she is a timid lady with blonde hair and pale skin from having spent to much time in ships with an affable if stubborn personality. Those who are close to her are always privy a fact that few are aware of; that the Black Lady of A-13 is dependant on diapers.

-Flashback-

Decades ago in a dorm room at Comanche High School, Unity District, New Providence a young Taliah Black is embroiled in a strip poker game with Accelra Hawk. She is losing, badly Taliah is now stark naked while Accelra has only lost her blouse "Come on Accelra a few more rounds? After I put on my back on clothes?" Taliah asks. Accelra gives the young lady of the look of exasperation "Taliah you know how the rules of the game besides you knew going into this that you were going to lose". "Yeah, yeah I know but please just these once" Taliah pleads. Accelra opens her mouth to say no but an idea pops into her head "Alright fine but for every piece of clothing and every round you lose is a day you have wear diapers". "Diapers? Why?" Taliah asks, "because it is going to teach you not to play stupid games that you know you're going to lose" Accelra replies. Then they play and Taliah loses game after game after game after game and as Taliah keeps stripping and as the game keeps resetting Accelra is keeping track. When Taliah gives up after hours of playing Accelra tells her the tally "So we played for what eight hours straight? In that time you took off your clothes 357 times and lost no less than 48 times which means that my dear Taliah you are stuck in diapers for 405 days". "405!?" Taliah exclaims in surprise. "Yep, hope you enjoy sitting in your own waste and remember you have to wear them at all times no exceptions and you must use for all their intended use." "Bu-" "No butts in Taliah you are stuck in diapers now deal with it". And she did for some 13 months Taliah Black went back to diapers full time as she completed her 2nd year of High School often leading to many embarrassing moments and humiliations for Taliah. By, the end, however, Taliah was a girl who had little control over her bladder and only slightly better control over her bowels while also finding a perverse pleasure in wearing diapers.

Now at age 43 as a young capable captain of a Prison ship Taliah faces many challenges including dealing with the ships Sarcastic AI Janet. Awaking from her slumber in a thoroughly used diaper Taliah hears her AI report "All systems normal, no reports of suspicious activity among the prisoners and pee-yew Captain your diaper is at 95% capacity and needs an immediate change unless you want diaper rash to go with your diaper." Taliah only groans in response walking over to the bathroom to dispose of her diaper and to take a shower. Exiting her quarters with a fresh diaper and her uniform on Taliah

1541121.content:
Honor Harrington, Admiral in the Maticoran and Grayson Space Navies, Steadholder and Countess, and a close confidant with both the Queen and Lord Protector Honor Harrington is one of the most notorious persons within the known Galaxy. Yet, she has a secret, a secret that is known only to her parents and her pet Treecat Nimitz and a handful of her most trusted subordinates.

Secretly Admiral Lady Dame Honor Harrington, Duchess and Steadholder Harrington was a diaper lover and a partial adult baby, someone who loved wearing and sometimes using diapers and acting like an overgrown child. It was something Harrington always had, yet, she only recently had the confidence to act on those desires and now with her career temporarily on ice following the end of the Haven-Monticoran war Stephanie Harrington is taking a well-deserved rest from the political war raged in the Commons and House of Lords to relax at her home in Grayson.

The welcome was gracious and friendly but, Honor didn't pay it much mind she had only one thing on her mind. Briskly walking through her Homestead to her quarter's Honor made sure to double lock the doors and informed her Armsmen to warn her of any guests. Unlocking a compartment in the bottom of her dresser Honor retrieved a stack of thick white diapers and some changing supplies, her hands caressing the soft plastic of the undergarment having changed little from its incarnation in the 21st Century savoring its feeling and smell.

Slowly undressing her skirt and panties Honor gently lay down on her soft comparted floor and slid the diaper under her applying powder and oil Honor slowly pulled the front of her diaper over her loins and affixed the tapes for a time Honor was bliss she rarely had time to indulge in her interests and she was determined to make the most of her time, after what seemed like an eternity Honor took herself up from the floor and began rummaging through her secret compartment receiving a Onesie and pacifier.

Removing the rest of her blouse Honor pulled the Onesie over her shoulders and attached the buttons with a sharp click. Plopping the Pacifier in her mouth Honor retrieved and few toys and began playing. Feeling a slight pressure in bladder Harrington simply released her bladder something she learned to do over the past few years and within moments a growing warmth spread through her crotch, it felt nice, pleasant even but Honor was soon torn from her moment of bliss by a message from Andrew the commander of her personal security detachment.

"Sorry to distrub you malady but, we have a visitor."

Honor gave a mental sigh of disappointment before replying

"Can it not wait, Andrew, I'm kind of busy"

"No Maladay it appears we are receiving _____ and they wish to discuss something with you "

15412.title: Someone else

info.brief_description: You are the captain of your very own space ship. But diapers await in the final frontier!
info.description:
It is 2166, in earth standard years, and you have found yourself at the helm of a spaceship. Mysteries and excitement awaits, but that isn't necessarily always for the best. AB/DL and adult themes inside, turn back if this isn't for you.

Sci-fi can be fairly complicated, so, here are the rules:

Faster than light travel (FTL) has been discovered. It works like hyperspace, with a finite number of lanes between star systems that ships move through.

You can move through the galaxy, but inter dimensional/inter universal travel is not an established thing (at least not yet.)

Aliens exist, and humans have intergalactic translators, at least with the ones they have already established contact with.

Try and keep existing sci-fi things in stories specified for those, (don't interrupt an original story with the force, or the reaper invasion, or something like that.)

Adult scenes are allowed.

Feel free to add!
info.pretty_title: The tales of a diapered space captain
